<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_stat:
```c
int lfs_stat(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path, struct lfs_info *info) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_stat(%p, \"%s\", %p)", (void*)lfs, path, (void*)info);

    err = lfs_stat_(lfs, path, info);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_stat -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_stat:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static int lfs_stat_(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path, struct lfs_info *info) {
    lfs_mdir_t cwd;
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return (int)tag;
    }

    // only allow trailing slashes on dirs
    if (strchr(path, '/') != NULL
            && lfs_tag_type3(tag) != LFS_TYPE_DIR) {
        return LFS_ERR_NOTDIR;
    }

    return lfs_dir_getinfo(lfs, &cwd, lfs_tag_id(tag), info);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The only potential invariant controlling expression in the provided code arises from the LFS_LOCK macro which evaluates to the constant 0. This makes the subsequent if (err) test invariant (always false) and thus should be investigated for compliance with Rule 14.3. Other controlling expressions are not invariant and therefore do not require investigation: - if (tag < 0) uses the value returned by lfs_dir_find and depends on runtime results. - if (strchr(path, '/') != NULL && lfs_tag_type3(tag) != LFS_TYPE_DIR) depends on the runtime value of path and tag and thus is not invariant. - The LFS_TRACE macro is defined empty and does not introduce any controlling expressions. - LFS_UNLOCK evaluates to (void)cfg (no boolean/control expression). The exceptions for permitted invariants (infinite loops and the do-while constant-false case) do not apply to the remaining conditionals above.
